title: Grateful Dead Live at Events Center, U of Colorado on 1981-12-09
lineage: Master Soundboard Cassette > Reel to Reel > DAT> CDR Sennheiser 421 Audience patch source
description: Cold Rain & Snow-> Jack Straw, Friend Of The Devil-> Little Red Rooster, Bird Song, Mama Tried-> Mexicali Blues, Candyman, Cassidy, Looks Like Rain, China Cat Sunflower-> I Know You Rider Scarlet Begonias-> Fire On The Mountain-> Estimated Prophet-> He's Gone-> Drums-> The Other One-> Stella Blue-> Around & Around-> Good Lovin', E:U.S. Blues-> E: Satisfaction

reviews.review_text: Great 2nd set Killer
Great Show with a long first set Excellent Quality Recording.  Smokin Rider (intense Phil)

DISC two wow nice setlist! - i wish i could have seen this one. great recording, first few song with minimal static... seems to be gone by Bird Song. thats as far as i am. looking forward to disc two:
Disc 2
1. China Cat Sunflower>
2. I Know You Rider
    2nd Set
3. Scarlet Begonias>
4. Fire on the Mountain
5. Estimated Prophet>
6. He's Gone>
    Jam>
7. Drums>
pretty much "THE" big juicy ones.
BOULDER.
download now!
terry
1st show This was my first show of an eventual 74.  I remember thinking that they played Stones songs better than the Stones.  This confirms it.

nice show The great suprise of the winter of 1981 was a Dead show at the Events Center. A freezing night outside and a HOT night inside. One of my all time favorite scarlet->fires, a real example of some extraordinary  interplay between Brent and Jerry during the segue. Bummer that the vbr of scarlet has a splice in it that other tapes I have of this show don't have. Closed the 2nd set with china->rider, and opened the second with scarlet->fire?!?! Are you kidding me? Weir was a bit drunk I think and did some hilarious "HA!"'s during he's gone, much to the chagrin of Jerry who just smiled politely and left the stage. Bob came back for the encore and said "We'll be back because we like it here"  - they never played there again. 

I did get to see my daughter graduate high school in the same building about 20 years later. Kind of a trip. ;-)

Yes - you should get this show. 

Graham

nice sound ... jerry too on vox I listened start to finish n I usually don't. Real nice show with 2nd set really payin off from the get go

give a listen

Oh, yeah, I remember this... Just downloading the show, but the thing I remember most about this was something my brother said.  

Toward the end of the show, the boys got a bit loud - Good Lovin' was one of the loudest things I ever heard.  He said that it was loud like "having a jet plane in your bathtub is loud".

Oh, yeah, that's why the ears ring so much...
Ultimate Rain LLR followed by China/Ryder has haunted me for years and years. Seriously... Listen to LLR and tell me it's not one of the best ever, and it just gets better from there...

Behind not left out finding the sound out front a little muddy my wife and i ended up behind the stage...racks of speakers focused in a VERY small space...didn't see much but had my eyes closed most of the time anyway..
Baby to be kickin' during drums...clean rep of this Grate show

LLR Wow, I'm downloading this show for sure...just got done listening to looks like rain and it is way up on my personal favorite list...and let me tell you, I've listened to countless LLR's. Check out 6-21-84, 3-24-88, and 3-30-88 for other great versions.
WOW!!!! The LLR is .........AMAZING!!!!!!!!I have to say that this a sleeper show!!!!

chemical fire This show was loud and powerful.  A schoolboy at CU in those days, I talked a variety of friends, few having yet witnessed live Dead, into stumbling across campus for the show.  We went in as a group and promptly lost each other in the chaos.  China Cat was ablaze, and after the show some of us suddenly realized we had again found each other standing in a nearby field.  There was no middle ground.  Folks were either sold and ready to tour, or it scared the hell out of them and they would never go to a show again.

Classic Dead!! The Dead at the CU Events Center, it doesn't get much better than this!!

It was a freezing night in Boulder, but inside was very hot and Loud!! the first set has some stellar moments. the Cold Rain is raw, The Bird Song is Epic and the LLR is the best ever and any show that ends the first set with China Cat > Rider  (one of my favorite versions of this jam) and starts the second set with Scarlet > Fire is Awesome in my book.  

Set 2 doesn't let up either, the Scarlet > Fire is definitely one for the ages and the Prophet through Other One > Stella Blue was classic.

 Top it off with a  US Blues > Satisfaction and you have a show that every Deadhead should have.

CHINA>RIDER UNFREEKINGBELIEVABLE!!!! This whole show is white hot!!! Especially FOTD, LLR, Bird Song, Cassidy...

The I know you rider is one of the best I have ever heard and I have listened to 500+ shows on this site.... Listen to Phil drop HUGE bombs and Jerry taking some notes to the nnnnth degreee.... Traiiiin... This place must have just been layed out after this. Unreal.

One of the best of '81 easily - Has same wildness of Rochester '80. Just heard it twice!

WOW, Best of '81!! After seeing this show being given five star reviews by both Purple Gel and Capn Doubledose in the last few days I had to give it a listen and WOW!!!!

I thought I had heard all the great '81 shows and then discovered this gem. IMO it ranks up there with my three '81 favorites New years , 9-11 and 9-12 Greeks,  and any other shows from that, or any year. What a find!!!

I Have to agree with the previous reviewers....  Awesome FOTD, Bird Song, Cassidy, Cold Rain, Candyman.....The greatest LLR, and China Cat -- I Know You Rider Ever, Jerry and Phil just take you to the moon!! 

2nd Set is just as awesome, starting with a Stellar Scarlet/Fire the energy just never lets up.... Awesome Estimated - He's Gone, a great Other one--Stella. This awesome SBD is one of my new favorite shows....WOW, this show is the creme de la creme of '81!!!

pleasantly surprised The Events Center is such a can, I'm amazed the recording is so sweet.  We met this old guy before the show who claimed to know Owsley... during China Cat people were bursting into flames, chunks of flesh falling to the floor, dancing flaming shaking bones of glee.  We found a friend after the show standing in a field not knowing where or who she was.  It took til dawn before she kissed me and said, "I'm back."  Good to be alive...

good setlist good show i think the LLR is a lil over rated, its one of my personal favorite dead songs, check out 3-31-84, j straw is disapointing, jerry was feelin it but someone got lost i guess, love the early 80s though and the second set has such a great list and great playing to back it up. although it seems like everyone is just in aww, where i am not, good show definetly but i wouldnt say its "dicks picks" worthy if you wanna go there, i've already said too much listen to it for yourself.

Last Boulder
Rather than the usual Colo run, this was a one off – not booked very far in advance – at the Coors Event Center (named for Adolph Coors' donation, not because it's a notorious party campus. The basketball can is, however, notorious for poor acoustics). Starting the double encore, Bobby says they'll be back because they like Boulder. But as it happened this would be the last of five shows there, the next 15 Colorado shows all being at Red Rocks. This was the middle of three trips to the Denver metro area in a little over a year (months earlier they played two nights in Denver and months later a 3-day Red Rocks run). Since the '75 hiatus they had built up one of their most loyal markets along the Front Range (of course, playing on a large campus known for hardcore music interest, you will have an audience). The show is known for Bobby supposedly being somewhat drunk. I can't say if that's true, but it isn't one of their top 20 Colorado appearances. It does have, as other noted, a strato China>Rider and some GOGD. Bobby's guitar is faint in places, almost degrading the show a notch. 1st Set. The average '81 first set – except for possibly the worst Jack Straw trainwreck ever, and for the awesome end pairing. Jer's Friend of the Devil solo is great and the quiet/spacey Bird Song comes back on a dime. Jer's solo is again unusual on Mexicali – he's having a good night, Bobby an off one. Likewise for Candyman, where the solo is inspired and very cool. Mama Tried is unremarkable, Cassidy is muffed, and by Looks Like Rain Bobby gets a Brand New Bag ("R-A-I-N", "Fuckin' Rain!!"). A bumptious delivery bordering on priapic silliness; but Bobby was never good at Rock Star™ posturing, nor did "wearing the Nudie suit" fit the band (short shorts however...). One of the year's best China>Riders starts uptempo but otherwise average, with the pace devolving until the China outro jam when Jer becomes inventive as fuck. During Rider he goes crazy with fills while Phil starts chording. I was compelled to puzzle-out some of these sticky little riffs, only becoming more impressed. At Colo shows Bobby would deliver "blow all my troubles away" and we'd bate breathing for the vox switch to Jer so we could go collectively nuts for cool Colorado rain. The guitar phrasing against the bass and keys is insane here. It's a knock-yer-sox version that rides as if the rails will split any second. Bobby's is getting weird though; like, variety show weird. 2nd set. Scarlet can't reach X factor but Fire hits a strong groove. Estimated has a good tempo but Bobby still finds it prudent to be James Brown (as a crow). Billy & Mickey are strong in He's Gone and ready to go into Drums, but Bobby and Brent wanna jam. S'cool. The band boards the ensemble cosmic transport for parts of The Other One but, it being a Jer show, Stella is where it treks. The end solo is very beautiful and ethereal. Phil is great here too. When Around & Around came up next I cringed. Given Bobby's carnivalesque attitude so far, I thought he might start hiccupping and barking (for rock & roll, wink) but he sobered up in time to give an average reading. Jer nonetheless is not ready to make this the closer, and because they also come back for a double encore (including 1 of 8 Satisfactions in '81), it's an almost-two-hour set. 1st Set:  B- 2nd Set: C+ Overall = 3¼ stars Highlights: China Cat>I Know You Rider – awesome, seat-of-your-pants version Stella Blue – Jer could wring sheer emotion from just a fretboard & strings SOURCES: The miller87349 source painstakingly upgrades the SBD. The Clugston is fine. (These are composites, not matrices). The whole show is on Dave's 20, patched & pitched (except for CR&S which needs -1% pitch correction).

total bliss THIS SHOW IS WHY WE TOURED. ITS NIGHT LIKE THIS JUST KICKED ASS, KINDA LIKE ALWAYS SEARCHING FOR THAT SAME PERFECT BUZZ . ( THAT BY THE WAY NEVER HAPPENS) ANYWAY i CONSIDER MYSELF SO LUCKY FOR NIGHT LIKE THIS.   I must have been to at least 100 or more shows up to this point and bammmmmm this is the night that never fades from memory. 5 STARS FOR THE MEMORY AND SOUND AND ENERGY OF THE CROWD AND BAND THIS NIGHT
Killer Show This show was awesome and I thoroughly enjoyed every moment.  The second set was especially killer, but the CC>Rider to close the first was awesome as well.  Enjoy this gem!

This is great This is a rather short concert for the Grateful Dead, but a great one. Worth the download. But because I am so damn picky about recording quality I rate it a 4 star (because of the audience mix). Matrix always gets a four start or below.
81 boulder Did you hear that cassidy? I mean, did you hear that! Did you hear what I just heard?

Parallel universe, or something... A short concert, Justin?  16 songs before drums (a China>Rider and a Scarlet>Fire, of all combos, back to back)and you call it short?  Matrix recordings are automatically downgraded, too?  WTF?  For example....go listen to the Hunter Seamon's matrix recording from 12/28/79 or 7/1/1985 and come back to us with what you report on those dreaded matrix efforts.  You could not ask for a better first set from the guys.  The second is no slouch, but boy the juice was really flowing in the first--minus the meandering that occurs during Jack Straw....I think maybe Bobby had too much too fast before show time. Colorado shows always turned Weir loose....

Catch a Detroit Lightning out of Santa Fe Burnt Rich..I'm with you on this one..down grade a show just because it's a matrix..WTF..The sound quality on this is exceptional..Great song selection and in the 1st set.. I really dig the Bird Song and Love,Love,Love the China>Rider to close the set!!!! A charged Scarlet>Fire to open a tight well played 2nd set..The Stella Blue starts out so slow and dreamy and Jerry builds it to a nice climax..A fitting encore Satisfaction to end a very good show..so please GIVE IT A WHIRL

My 1st Grateful Dead show~ LOVE & LIGHT ~*~ The show the bus came by and I got on at, where it all began for me.
Still on the bus and sharing with my 4 sons the incredible sounds...Update 10/25/16 this show is being released on the 1st of November 2016 as Dave's Pick Vol. 20...

- Not a great soundboard, but at least as good as any of the others, and better than the Wise AUD. 

Fantastic, unbelievable Scarlet/Fire.

I'll take your word on the sound quality ... ... heard the whole show on Sirius and it's great.  Maybe the best of 81.  This was not a year for super long jams, but rather short, hot jams sometimes appearing out of nowhere.  Like in Jack Straw when Bob was lost and Jerry tried to make something of it.  OK, that didn't work, but then FOTD gets them focused again.  LRR -- OK, Bob, you had your fun with the slide, now Jer' will show you how it's done.  Oh, BTW, no, you HAVE a little red rooster.  Birdsong is a nice, pretty version at the typically fast 81 tempo, a good mid set jam.  Then we get a hot Cassidy and an absolutely screaming China>Rider.  12 song first set with some jams.  By 86 it would be half that length some nights.

Scarlet>Fire, what can you say, this is a typically smoking 81 version.  Estimated >He's Gone, pretty standard stuff, but Brent gets things going out of He's Gone into a short Drums but a long Space/Jam.  The Other One is typical of this period, but Stella is a standout.  Jerry never played it with more emotion and yet such sweetness.  Shows the power and versatility of that wonderful Tiger guitar.  We get Good Lovin' to close and a double encore.
